values: Never have I been so excited about snow here!  Today was my first official snow day from school.  It is just great and to top it all off....Cold Mountain is on tv!  Great afternoon of watching and finishing the last of my AP essays.

we bought a car last night!  A brand new car!  It is black with gray interior and it is brand new!  Our first big purchase, it is very exciting!  He nows gets to drive my SUV and I get to drive the new car!  I put thirty miles on it today and hardly went through any gas!  My gas bill is looking so low now compared to the V8 all-wheel drive SUV.  

WE HAVE A BRAND NEW CAR!  I am so excited!

Tomorrow is my first day at Loudoun County.  Tomorrow is the big "welcome to Loudoun County" day of festivities to make all of us new hires to feel proud and welcomed to the school district.  Following that I have two and a half days of new hire professional development at my high school then the rest of the faculty comes back and thus the real school year begins.  Last year I was scared of school starting.  I was scared of what was to come and a lot did come.  When I was involuntarily transferred to Ballou I had no feelings.  I just didn't care but when I was hired at Loudoun County I was sad to leave Ballou.  Ballou defined me as a teacher and made me realize that I am a good teacher and shouldn't feel bad about the transfer.  The transfer was the best thing that happened to me.  It was what led me to Loudoun and to the awesome position that I now have.  Not all first year teachers get to teach AP classes and I do.  The people that I met at Ballou have influenced me and have helped me tremendously in my fight with DCPS.  My friendship with the Union Representative gave me an insight into what was wrong with DC and how to fight back DCPS.  I hate DCPS with a passion.  If they were not so bad I would still be at Ballou leading the social studies department in the ninth grade academy (which they selected me for and I interviewed the other teachers to be included in the academy and all the while I was leaving....) but now I am back at the bottom starting over.  

This time it is different.  I am at a school that wants me and sees my potential.  I know I will not be involunarily transfered and I can put my name on stuff!  I can put my name on my teacher's book and my materials.  I even get materials.  Real teaching materials!  This point last year I bought around 300.00 worth of stuff for the school year, this year, only 20.00 and this was for art supplies for myself and binders.  I can't wait for the school year to start.  I can't wait to use power point and the overhead projector and I am especially excited about slide shows using pictures that I have collected on different parks and museums.  The kids will see me as a dork.  That is alright.  I have accepted it.  

Housewarming Party Saturday.  If you are cool you received your evite invitation...see you on Saturday!

to ever move again.  Packing and loading up the car is not how I want to spend my time off.  I will be staying in the townhouse for a lot of years before I have to move again.  By then I hope to not be burned out from moving like I am right now.

After finishing my slice of pizza and settling in to a relaxing night with my mom in my apartment, I heard drips and I looked around and saw that the fire alarm had water leaking out of it.  I put a pan underneath it and it filled almost immediately.  I called the Cloisters Maintenance hotline and no one answered.  I went upstairs to R-34 and they didn't have any water in their apartment.  Back to my apartment to the fire alarm still leaking water and now the fire alarm was going off.  I called the maintaince hotline again and no answer.  My mother began packing her bags to go stay at my new townhouse and I went looking for the maintenance men down the road.  I found them, they came half an hour later and the fiance had already left the new townhouse in order to come over and see if he can help.  The maintenance guy came, ripped (literally) the fire alarm out of the ceiling, informed me that R-34 hot water tank had ruptured in the floor between our two apartments and that the water will still be coming out for awhile and not to worry.  He would be coming back tomorrow to install a brand new fire alarm.  I am so glad that I am moving out.  This tonight reminded me why I am leaving my apartment and going to a new townhouse.  I can't wait to move.  I will miss this apartment.  It has so many memories of my new life in DC.  This is where I met new friends, had grand adventures and parties and of course where my relationship with my fiance began and expanded into a great relationship.  Sue, DC is going to be awesome for you!

When I was in Buffalo this past weekend, Katja told me that I have a really nice life in DC.  It struck me as odd that she would say this but I believe it.  I love DC.  I am so glad that I moved down here and I did it alone.  I am proud that I took the chance to start anew and I did it alone.  I always admired the people that moved without knowing someone and never thought I could do it.  I do miss Buffalo and I realized it while I was there for the long weekend.  I finally attended The Taste of Buffalo and got to really hang out with my favorite people that mean so much to me.  Plus the fiance got to see Buffalo and the night life....which is not the same down here in DC!

This is my first day of summer!  I slept in and now will be eating a big bowl of cereal.  I have a big day of cleaning out my stuff at the fiances and then returing lots of library books!  The next couple weeks will be very busy with a week workshop at Mount Vernon then a week of AP US History training.  By then I will be ready to go home and plan my wedding!  Yeah!

I hate the District of Columbia Public Schools system.  I love where I teach now but I hate the school system.  Not only are they closing or consolidating 30 schools, they are reorganizing Ballou where I work.  I knew that something would happen with my job again after being transferred so I have already job searched and have been hired by a VA school district.  (Of course no one knows this in DC except for Ms. Iverson and Madame Roberson just in case the job in VA doesn't go through!)  The VA school district is helping me get my VA license and I have all my required documents but I need one thing from DCPS.  Today I left school early, took my students to Ms. Iverson's room to finish their projects and drove up to Union Station to park my car in the horrible expensive parking garage.  I proceeded to walk to 825 North Capitol Street NW and made it to the 6th floor HR office.  I encountered the receptionist who was on the phone when I got there and was on the phone the whole time I was talking with her.  I told her I needed a form signed by HR to say that I was indeed a DCPS employee.  She told me to leave the form with her and she would see it to the respective department and then they would send it back to me.  Now, you don't leave anything with HR.  It is like an abyss down there.  You leave something for your personal file and POOF! It vanishes!  You leave something to be signed and POOF! that has vanished.  I told the receptionist that I have no intentions of leaving anything with her because I would never get it.  She told me that the person in Verification was horribly busy today.  She was processing 14,000 applicants information alone.  I told her that I would wait until closing time and have her sign the form because this needs to be done today.  The receptionists then said that I should come back.  I asked her when, she said tomorrow, thursday maybe even as early as friday.  She was not sure when the one lady in verification would be done.  I then looked at her and said, "Why would I expect to get any customer service here?  There is always a problem down here and no body here seems to be able to help anyone."  I turned and left.  The receptionist started up her telephone conversation again.  It seems that now that I want to leave DCPS they are making it impossible.  To stay would be even more impossible.  This whole district sucks.  I feel so bad for the students here.  No one cares about them.  On a side note, the HR division is undergoing massive lay-offs and they are implementing an automated HR phone service.  I have a feeling that it won't be any more effective than the idiots they have working down there currently.

It is the strangest thing for me to be engaged.  I was certain that I would be 30 and still single.  I would be the one going alone to the weddings or having that burden of finding someone to go with.  I am now the person that is getting married first and will never have to worry about finding a date or going alone.  Last night we talked about wedding plans and details and he admitted to me that he also thought he would be single at 30.  What happened we wondered and then realized that some things in life you can't control.  If he did go to grad school at William and Mary we would have never met.  If I didn't come to DC we would never have met.  But somehow we did met and now we are getting married in about a ton of months.  There is so much to being engaged and it wasn't until sunday night at the Grog that I realized that I was getting married.  The Grog was an Engagement Get-Together which also had one of our friends playing for the night.  When he called us to the front of the bar and had us stand right there next to him and announced that we were engaged and our wedding date was..... and then my baby kissed me and everyone clapped.  We are getting married and now all the planning and hair pulling can begin.  It is also very strange to be introduced as his fiance.  I visited his workplace yesterday and met the clan he works with and then he said, "...this is my fiance, Liz."  Just sounds so weird.  Back to enjoying my Spring Break!

August 2004 is when I moved here to DC.  I moved in with person I didn't know and started a job that I knew I would hate.  I grew to be friends with my roommate and found my job wasn't rewarding but I ended up meeting and being friends with some great people.  At that first job I met an awesome boy who became my boyfriend.  That boyfriend decided on Sunday that we should be together forever and on Sunday afternoon after we walked around the Cherry Blossom festival and stood in front of the Washington Monument looking at the Capital Building, he proposed.  I am engaged to my baby and I am so excited!  My move to DC ended up being not so bad in the long run.  It has been an exciting last couple of days telling and calling everyone.  I kinda want him to propose again but he really wasn't interested in that....:-)

Did the railroad strike end with labor winning or management winning?
Yes Jeffrey,
Ms. Povero you're a MILF.
What Jeffrey?!
The whole class starts giggling and the boys are all embarressed along with Jeffrey placing his head on his desk and not saying a word the rest of class.
I guess I am considered a MILF here at Ballou....

I have laryngitis.  It sucks completely.  I took today off from school because I need to rest my voice and I went to the doctor to make sure I didn't have something else.  I have never felt the need to talk as much as I do right now.  My parents will not pick up their cell phone so I can't talk to them and my baby won't pick up his phone so I can't talk to him.  I know it is only for the benefit of saving my voice but I want to talk!  I have a presentation tonight for my class and I have this outstanding lesson to present but I can't.  I am not even going to stay for the whole class because I will talk and I need to save my voice for my formal observation at the end of this week.  On a lighter note, I bought The Office Season One DVD and will spend the afternoon watching and planning for the upcoming weeks.

I always knew that DCPS was in pretty bad shape with its administration and the way the HR department does business.  I knew that Ms. Clara Bowers who had the classroom space next to me would bring me bad luck.  For what I already knew I shouldn't have been that surprised that when returning from Pittsburgh (after dealing with the death of my uncle and all the problems that he left behind and spending a week on bereavement leave) I got my mail and found a letter saying that I had been transfered and that my new school starting date was today (this was saturday).  Before I left for Pittsburgh, Ms. Clara Bowers was transfered to Ballou but she was fighting with the Union over it saying it wasn't right and such.  On a side note:  Ms. Bowers is the worst teacher there is.  She does nothing in class but talk on her cell phone and yell at the kids, do you think I am stupid I hear what you are doing over there! and then she comes and does a buffet line in my classroom taking my ideas, handouts, etc and she does this for all the teachers that teach the same subject as her.  Shaw (my former school now) has been trying to get rid of her for over a year and a half now but she always stays because the Union fights for her.  So the Union fought for her again and let her stay at Shaw and had me leave without telling me.  Being transfered is horrible.  My students are upset and the whole order in the 8th grade house is over.  Ms. Bowers will be teaching all the students now and well there is going to be a lot of 8th graders that know nothing about US History and DC History.  The funny thing is, the school that I was transfered to is the worst school in the district with every problem you can think of.  With my visit today I am only going to be teaching three classes.  One Street Law which I only supervise because Georgetown Law students come in and teach that and two US History classes that contain 11th and 12th graders.  My schedule is easy and the students thus far are not that bad at all.  The 11th and 12th graders are students that want to be there and want to learn.  Ms. Bowers really did herself in this time.  This school would have been perfect for her but alas she stayed at Shaw and effective friday, the 8th grade history position will be cut due to lack of budget.  For some reason I am so happy about that because when a position is cut, you don't get a transfer but a red slip.  Justice does come through somehow.  Now I wait while applying to VA schools because I will be living there in due time.....

I'm coming
I'm coming home to you
I'm alive, I'm a mess
I can't wait to get home to you
To get warm, warm and undressed
There have been changes beyond my dreams
Everyone wants me to sing
Been my changes beyond my grasp
Things are sinking in

It was so hard to say goodbye this morning.  A perfect night with friends and a perfect morning filled with love only to end as he went to work.  I miss working with him every day.

Since I am not working at the museum anymore, I can't continue my one-woman protest against the bus after I get off the metro.  Now I am fully involved in my one-woman protest against the weather.  I refuse to bow down to the humidity, wetness and heat of this day or any other day to follow.  I think this time I will succeed in my protest!

Today I have realized that I live in DC.  I call  DC home.  I look forward to coming home to The Cloisters and seeing the gate guy.  I like driving on 395 and spending the day walking to a museum and ten minutes later being in Target buying face wash.  I think this past year has really made me aware of who I am and who I wanted to be.  I love DC and I love calling DC home.

Seeing that it has been almost a year, I thought maybe I should post.  A lot has happened since moving to DC.  I moved here for my job at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum with no expectations at all and that all changed by the end of September.  I loved my job and everyone that I worked with.  DC is fantastic for doing just about anything and I have done tons!  Having wednesday and thursday off are not fun but they have turned out to be not so bad.  No one shops on wed and thurs and there is never a line for any sort of business transaction that needs to be completed.  Going out on tues/wed night is great in the fact that you have the bar to yourself and the drinks are always cheap!  Good thing the Holocaust job was not one that required much thought after learning all the tours or the weekends would have been disastrous with all of us dragging in after our nights out together.  The people I have met here are awesome and I don't know what I would do if I didn't met them.  My roommate is the best I have ever have and she loves baseball which only means we have been to everyone home game possible.  Doesn't help much that she gets free season tickets from her boss at work.  I did get to attend inauguration and I didn't care that Bush was still in office but it was awesome to be there for that moment when the president (whoever it is) takes that oath.  The only real celebrity I have met is Jenna Bush and I gave her the tour of the museum so that was cool but the school group she brought with her was not so much.  This past spring brought much change.  I found my history geek in January at work and still love seeing him each day and going to all the museums and events together, he is just the perfect thing that DC has given me.  I also have found a new job here in DC.  I am now an 8th grade teacher of US History at Shaw JHS.  I have changed my license to DC and my car registration.  I now officially live in DC and probably will for a long time.  My life has changed dramatically since moving here and I love every minute of it!
Tonight at 10:55pm, my goldfish Sig died.  He lived for three years, four months and six days.  My tank is empty now and I am sad.  I don't plan on having anymore goldfish.

Today I experienced life with short hair.  I cut my hair yesterday and got up today to a new life and attitude.  I miss my long hair, even though it wasn't that long.  My hair is shorter than it ever has been and my hair color has changed to a light brown with carmel blonde highlights.  I use wax in it and for once my parents enjoy my hair.  I saw The Village tonight.  Once you see it talk to me about it.  You will understand.  Sue did and we talked about it and she was right.  Miss Buffalo already and totally miss Lauren and Megan.  I wonder if they are still walking and planning a night out tomorrow?  I miss watching Firefly at Sue's eating popcorn and Chex Mix.  I miss Lindsay when watching TV and needing someone to laugh at my Mark Comito jokes that I still make.  Oh well, lots to miss but what lies ahead will one day be missed also.  So much to do right now.  Threw out my back again.  How is that going to help the moving process?!  I will let you all know on Saturday.  Maybe.

could cause so much ruckus in a oldsmobile alero.  Lauren and I thought there was a cricket in the car with us.  I unbuckled my seat belt to go into the back seat and check it out.  We both were scared and me more so cause that cricket could jump on me any chance it got.  Needless to say, there was no cricket and after opening the rear door twice, it was outside the car.  This all occurred in a traffic back up that occurred outside of Dipson Amherst Theatre after a prescreening of Danny Deckchair.  Which I might add is a great movie.  I suggest that everyone go and see it.  Bob and Megan thoroughly enjoyed it along with Lauren and I.  If Bob and Megan are sold, then it has to be a really great movie.  Gonna miss these nights of free movie screenings and the events that seem to always occur when going to one.

So as I was laying in bed, falling asleep my cell phone rings and it is my parents.  They tell me (at 2:17am) that they can't find a hotel room to stay in after driving from Louiseville, KY and that they are going to drive home and not stop to see me.  I wanted them to see me and have a meal with me, I was okay that they were going home.  They couldn't find a place so whatever.  They called back at 2:35am and told me that they are going to stay at my place and that I should move my car for parking for my dad's 1948 Mercury.  So my parents arrive at 3:11am and I find a parking spot, get them into the apartment, make up the futon which I have to sleep on and off to bed we all go.  I wake up in the morning to my dad swearing over the cat in my bedroom and at 8:48am I get up to start my morning with my parents.  It is so weird when you are getting ready in your own apartment with your mother in the bathroom washing up and your father in the kitchen washing his face.  I never had the experience where my father asked me for shaving cream and I didn't have any.  I never had the experience of my parents both sleeping in my bed and treating this night as a big ol' sleepover.  I did get a nice yummy breakfast across the street and my parents came with me to work to get the tour experience from their daughter.  Comes to find out, my great-grandfather attended the Pan-Am Exposition and has one of the souvenirs that we have in an exhibit case.  Well my dad has the souvenir now but that is still pretty interesting.  All in all, I felt like a true adult.  When your parents stay the night at your place and you give them break and strawberries for home, that is adult.  I love my parents and I love spending time with them all the time now.  It is weird that it took me 23 years to finally get to this place.  I like it though.  I really like spending time with my parents and talking like an adult to them.

There was this time tonight where I was just happy.  Sitting there in Cole's with Amber, Bob, Gak and Megan where I was just happy.  Madonna's song, Like a Prayer played and it was just nice.  Had a great evening.  Had my pursed repaired by Sue, had a nice bronwie a la mode and some chex mix while watching Forrest Gump.  Didn't want to go to Cole's but thought I should to see Amber and it was fun.  Everyone seems to know somewhere where I am going and it makes me feel good to know that so many people care.  People really do care and I think I am right in what I might be doing.  We will see.

Tonight, I wrote on a bathroom wall.  The first time ever.  I first wrote a response to a girl that wrote, "all girls at Gabels are ugly" by saying that "all girls at Gabels are hot!"  (Not the best response but I was drunk) Then Megan persuaded me to write, "Megan and Liz are hot!"  Which I thought was the best response to all posting in that bathroom stall.  We then decided that it is the first time that we both were on a bathroom stall door with a good meaning.  Gabels is fun even if you have to put up with baby joe mese(spelling on that?) and his cohorts of ugly women and ugly men.  Come on now, he can't fight, what is so great about him now?

Teddy Roosevelt today was super busy.  Took yesterday off and Mark C. took today off so I was all by myself giving tour after tour to these yuppie people who just LOVE Teddy R.  I got mean to visitors and I hate when I start to get like that.  They just have a bad experience and I just hate being mean to them when I know they don't know I gave five tours in a row and still haven't had lunch or something to drink.  My bona-fide 'tough' car is not so 'tough' anymore.  Stupid thing wouldn't start today at all.  I had to drive it with my foot on the accelerator and my other foot on the brake to actually move it into a space off the street.  I called my father and he said that I needed to drive it to the dealership here.  Drive it!  I can't even drive it down a closed street into a parking spot, I have to now drive to Niagara Falls Blvd to get it looked at?  The roommate and I played a good game of who would you have sex with? while we made dinner and had some drinks.  I think everyone should play that game because the outcome is great.  Italian Festival is tomorrow and already the port-a-potties beneath our windows are being used.  So gross.  Why do they have to be there?  I just hope no smells come up my way and cross your fingers that my SUV 'tough' car will start tomorrow.

Finally home from another weekend in NYC.  Had tons of fun and was introduced to sushi, The Donkey Show, "water", a new term for condiments and Toxic Audio.  I enjoyed everything and relaxed.  Learn some things this weekend about myself that I really need to take ahold off.  Even if a person doesn't know you that well, I believe some things can be taken to heart.  It takes someone on the outside to identify things that I repress on the inside.  Another week of packing but no flying which relieves me.  Driving on the thruway never sounded so good after my E train experience with my big, heavy bag.  I miss Lauren and Megan this weekend so much.  I haven't spent nearly enough time with then as I should and I just started realizing how great they are and I will miss then whenever and wherever my life takes me.  Time for bed and sleep.  Just good ol' uninterrupted sleep in my own not-so-green-Kermit-like bed.

There is nothing like turning up the volume to Madonna's Immaculate Collection.  Last night as I was driving back from Megan's with Lauren, we blasted Like a Prayer and it was great.  Just singing and singing our hearts out.  Made me so happy and we danced in the car at each stoplight.  People next to us looked at us funny but it was okay, it was just fun.

Well firstly, the Anchorman sucked.  Thank god it was free!  Darcy M'Gee's whole bouncer staff was in attendance and that was funny all in its own.  Lauren was standing outside when they all came in and since they know us pretty well through Jared, we all had a good laugh when we realized we all came on tickets we all received on Thursday night.  Work is super busy right now but trying to keep up with my reading and my correspondences during working hours.  I know this is not a good working relationship but you have to do what you have to do.  So tired and still havn't unpacked from last weekend and need to pack again for this weekend.  I want one weekend with no packing and no going some other place.  I just want to stay in Buffalo and hang out all day and not even shower and watch TV and eat horrible food that I bought at City Grocery.  It sounds absurd but it is the small things that make me happy right now.

It is weird how sometimes a simple disney movie can really make you happy.  Watching A Goofy Movie tonight made me so happy and forget about everything that is bothering or stressing me out.  Goofy and Max are just some fun characters and the adventures they encounter are great.  Watch A Goofy Movie and you will see how happy you are afterwards.

Driving home today from Seneca Falls, I listened to Coldplay and found the most beautiful song that I have heard in a long time.  It just moved me to listen to this song and I just can't get enough of it.  Wish I had green eyes after listening to this song....

Honey you are a rock
Upon which I stand
And I come here to talk
I hope you understand
That green eyes
Yeah the spotlight shines upon you
And how could anybody deny you
I came here with a load
And it feels so much lighter
Now I met you
And honey you should know
That I could never go on without you
Green Eyes
Honey you are the sea
Upon which I flow
And I came here to talk
I think you should know
That green eyes,
You're the one that I wanted to find
And anyone who tried to deny you
Must be out of their mind
Because I came here with a load
And it feels so much lighter
Since I met you
And honey you should know
That I could never go on without you
Green Eyes
Green Eyes
Ooh ooh ooh ooh
Ooh ooh ooh ooh
Ooh ooh ooh ooh
Honey you are a rock
Upon which I stand

I won.  I won at a casino.  35.00 to be exact and I am excited about that.  So very tired--I just need to sleep in and not wake up for about 20 hours I think.  Can't wait for Sunday, just gotta make it until Sunday....

I have no idea.

No idea at all.

Should I have an idea?

Or not.

Excited. Frustrated. Unsure. Scared. Happy. Comfertable. Unsure.  Lost.  Some words to describe myself right now.  Had an experience this past weekend that I feel is showing the change I should make.  Is showing the change I need to make.  Something needs to change in my life and I need to do it.  I am going to do it but it is going to take time and energy that I hope to find very soon.  I am anxious and unsure of everything that is to come.  I am upset and frustrated and blame to many things on my own actions and the actions around me.  I must take responsibility and grow from each experience.  I need to grow to foster and nurture something but I don't know what it is.  I really don't know what it is and I am trying so hard to find that.  Sometime soon.  Not so lost.  Not so unsure but maybe happy and excited.

Optimistic.  That is what everyone keeps telling me.  Be optimistic don't be pessimistic.  It is easy to be pessimistic and every time that I am optimistic, it doesn't turn out well.  Funny to think about being positive only ends up being negative.  I am optimistic again and I know that I want to be pessimistic, pessimism never disappoints and I like that.  I just want that feeling that comes from being optimistic and positive.  I want to feel successful and that I am on my way to what I want.  What do I want?  I don't know.  I am trying to be optimistic about that.

I have some strong feelings right now.  At the bottom, can I go further down?  Never felt so let down in my life but that is life as my parents say.  So much happening and going on that I don't know where to start.  No sleep.  No eating.  Just here at the computer searching, but searching for what?  I don't know what I want to be.  After five years of college you would think I would know but I have no idea.  Maybe more school, maybe federal government work or maybe teaching.  I have no idea.  I wish I knew.  I wish I would be happier and more alive but I am not.  I feel like a cardboard statue that everyone looks at and smiles at and reads a little about then moves on to the next exhibit.  Nothing interesting here just words, thoughts and no feelings.

This weekend was fun.  Received my new vehicle, a mercury mountaineer and had to give up my ford escort zx2 which is very sad.  I saw some old friends and school friends who I have not seen in awhile.  I went to a father's day car show with my father today and was a judge for the car show.  That was so exciting!  Being able to judge people's interior and if they were mean or looking over my shoulder, I marked them down.  So mean but well worth it.  This is this boy that ever since I was like in 6th grade has liked me.  Every year at this car show he follows me and talks to my father about me but never talks to me.  Very odd.  This year I approached him and made some small talk to be the only one talking.  So odd.  He has gotten better looking through the years but this whole conversation thing and still not talking to me after like 10 years is a little odd.  He is about three to four years older than me so a 26 to 27 year old is still having trouble making small talk with me and I have known him for awhile.  My dad loves the boy and he does have good 'paper' qualities.  Has a good job, owns a classic car and knows how to drive a car rough and how to do burnouts.  Very big items in my book.  His parents are also very interested in me and wanting me to be around.  I think they see marriage bells and I saw no future with him.  It is nice to be liked and have someone watch you and follow you (in a nonstalking type of way) around and know that he likes you so much that he is intimidated by you.  This is not something that I encounter frequently so I must bask in the glory of it now.  Although, if any of you saw this person, my basking in the glory might not be so glorious anymore....

Well today was my real last day at UB SEL library and it was sad.  I really enjoyed working there and I am going to miss it a lot.  I did end up with some really great books and I can't wait to use them.  I am starting at Teddy Roosevelt tomorrow and need to really go over my tour but I am going to write up some note cards real quick for the things that I am having trouble remembering.  Tonight is low key and will be viewing The Stepford Wives.  I wanted to see this movie and I am excited about it.  I am going home for the weekend and can't wait.  I am going to Canal Fest with the girls from women's rights and we always have fun at these things.  I hope it doesn't rain because I really want to see the fireworks.  Every other year it has rained and I hope it doesn't this year.  Today is a sad day, one month ago my grandma died.  I still can't believe that she died.  I never thought it would happen and I still can't comprehend it.  I still think I have to see her at the nursing home and I still collect all these little things for her and then remember that she is not here anymore.  I found a letter from her the other night and it made me so sad.  I miss my grandma so much and I am going to miss her for all the big things that I have to experience in my life.  I still can't bring myself to take down all my sympathy cards.  I really don't want to forget what happened and wish that I had more time with her even though I had a lot of time and memories with her.  I still can't believe that God let her suffer as much as He did.  It makes me so mad to think that God would let something like that happen but my mother told me that those that believe the truest are the one that suffer and did she suffer.  I will be visiting her grave this weekend with my dad and hopefully the flowers are still pretty.

So tonight was thursday in the square and it was fun. I hung out with Megan and Lauren and everyone that I have missed these first few weeks of summer.  It is so scary to know that this is my last summer in Buffalo and I have no idea where I am going to end up.  Tonight I got mad though, for the first time in my life I said what I felt and I got yelled at.  We were at McMonkees and I was talking to this guy who is a school counselor.  We were really hitting it off (in a good conversation way) and I was impressed by his politeness and sensibility on so many things.  All of a sudden, the girls that I was with, Lauren, Liz and Britany wanted to leave and they wanted to leave NOW.  No questions asked.  So I left, they are my ride, as we walked downstairs, they found people they knew and one hour later, we left.  I was so mad.  I put up with them talking and kissing and making out with these boys they knew and I couldn't even have one conversation with this boy that I had a common interest in?  Why do I have to give up my time to let them do their thing.  I told Lauren this when she asked me why I was upset and she got mad saying that I should go upstairs and come down when I was ready when I know that would piss them off even more.  I hate that I am so nice and can't think of myself for once.  I hate that I am just a carpet that so many people just walk over.  I have feelings and I have a selfish part to me but I am so scared that people will get mad at me that I do what they want to do.  I told Lauren all of this and she understood but her friends were definetely not buying it.  They said he wasn't cute and I shouldn't have been talking to him anyways.  I could have told them about their boys all night but I knew as they were sucking face with them that that would hurt them but they can tell me that so that can go get Jim's Steakout and leave cause their boys were gone?  Not very happy right now but didn't see my ex so that is a good, actually excellent.  I heard from Megan though that Mike is trying to see Keri and she wants to see him.  I told Megan to tell Keri that they should both go for it.  Finally they can get it on without cheating on me, they have my blessing and I wish the best for them, the unemployed casino worker and the neurotic female.

I hate my ex-boyfriend.  I don't even want him to touch me or even get near me.  Yet he continues to call even though I don't return phone calls at all.  I hate how he thinks and acts as though he knows everything....believe me, he doesn't.  There is rumor that he lost his job but I don't know and that would only consist of me having to call and find out but by calling I open up another two week window of him calling me, which I don't want.  I know someone I will run into him tonight and I am dreading it thoroughly.  He thinks he is all that and cool and well he isn't.  I don't know what I saw in him two years ago at all.  I don't like the person that I am around him and I don't like him at all.  Two weeks ago he wrote me this sticky note of how much he loves me and wants me in his life.  He is a funny way of showing it by putting me down and saying that I have gained weight.  Well, I don't think he has looked into the mirror lately cause he is not a thin boy anymore.  He is huge if you ask me and he doesn't carry his weight well at all.  I don't want to see him, talk to him or even run into him tonight.  Even though I know he won't have any money and will try to bum off of me or his two idiotic friends who one I hate so much I don't want to see his face again.  Enough venting.

So went rollerblading tonight at Delaware Park and decided to go to Hannah's Frosty Treat with Tarin for a treat.  Baby Joe Mesi was there and we got pushed out of the way!  I was so mad at that.  He can't even fight anymore and he had a stupid girlfriend with him.  The girl that was waiting on me was in disbelief that he was there and was oggling him and forgot my order, gave me the wrong change and then Baby Joe's arm was pushing past me to the window to get the premade order that was there for him.  I got pushed out of the way by Baby Joe and his ugly girlfriend!  Not so nice of him and ruined my ice cream experience.  Stupid boxer, maybe his problem is him manners or that brain swelling that is affecting it (at least that is my hypothesis on the matter!).

Today is the day that I get my AC back in the window.  I am thoroughly looking forward to that.  My parents should be arriving shortly and I can't wait.  I attempted to prepare the coffee maker for my mom but before I brew I plan on having her check the measurements because I really don't know how to make coffee.  I found out some really cool things about live journal from my friend so I know more about interest groups and joining groups and such.  It is so warm out today that I want to get some sun but it is so windy so I am concerned about getting blown around out there.  Today is the day that I am officially done with graduate school.  I turned in my portfolio to my advisor and that is it.  I am done, class of 2004, University at Buffalo Graduate School of Education.  I know have an EdM.  All I need now is a job but that is another concern and another topic that I don't really want to talk about right now.  I keep looking at my red escort ZX2 and I am already starting to miss driving it.  My parents sold my car this past weekend to my neighbor and now I will be getting the mountaineer but I don't feel prepared for the mountaineer just yet.  Next weekend my car is gone so I have a few days left of driving around in it and paying the gas prices which I think are expensive in my car before the expensive gas guzzling mountaineer joins me in Buffalo.  Although, I wonder where I am going to park it successfully each day.

Lunch went really well with Mrs. Corrigan today.  I miss her so much and I am so jealous of her!  She is going to China this October.  That would be an amazing trip if you ask me. I hope I get a job soon so that I can ask her for help on different units and plans because she always has good ideas when it comes to teaching.  Maybe if I get a job too, Mrs. Corrigan can come in and teach my class about China.  She would love to do that!  Didn't hear from any schools today so not feeling accomplished right now.  Kinda gloomy right now actually.  I have to clean the apartment tonight because my parents are coming in tomorrow to put in my air conditioner!  Very excited about that and seeing my parents.  I am also excited about getting a work out buddy at UB.  I should have asked to go walking with Susan sooner than this because I could have been sleeping longer and or getting more workouts in.

Finally going to work at UB this morning.  I have to send out a placement file from Canisius first and go to the post office.  Every morning is the same, all these errands before working at UB.  I hate Canisius' placement file sending system.  I owe them about 60.00 right now for sending out my personal information.  That is absurd and I hate Canisius for that.  I only paid them enough in tuition that they have to charge me to try and get a job.  I am looking for a job which means I have no money to pay them for the sending out of the file.  On a lighter note, I am having lunch today with Mrs. Corrigan.  I miss my cooperating teacher but today we are going to catch up.  We are eating at Daffodil's on Maple Road.  I am making sure to dress nice because I know she will be.  I bought these great suck it in underpants thing so I can wear this dress without the panty hose underneath.  Target has yet to disapoint me.  I have these great new shoes also from Payless that are so cute!  I can't wait to wear them either.  Now off to another Tuesday.

Finally back in Buffalo from a long weekend at home that lasted until today unexpectedly.  I missed work today and feel bad about it because there is only so many days left that I am going to be a UB SEL employee.  I didn't get to see Harry Potter this weekend and bummed but I will have more chances this upcoming weekend.  I re-potted two of my plants today in very lovely pots.  I bought these plants when I first moved into this apartment and feel connected to them.  I impulsively bought a planter filled with geraniums, coleus, petunias and some yellow flower.  The man that sold the planter assured me that these are all sun flowers and will take lots of sun. I can't wait for it to get big and beautiful as the man said they would.  I saw my park ranger friends this weekend and discovered that I miss them so much.  We went hiking in Watkins Glen and had a picnic.  It was so much fun, I can't wait to see them again.  I miss working at Women's Rights this summer and (gasp....)miss being home for some reason.  I do like Buffalo and know that if I did go home, I will miss Buffalo as well.  Now to unpack everything that I brought home that seemed to multiply by ten.

Big day ahead of me today.  I have an interview and a doctor's appointment.  The interview is a drive and I hope all works well and I impress the interviewers.  Driving home for the weekend again to help my parents with the garage sale and to see my friends from home.  I miss being in Seneca Falls for the summer but I would miss being in Buffalo even more.  I have to get ready quickly today because off to church to hopefully get blessed for the interview.  I tried going on Sunday but there was this chase-manhatten half marathon and I couldn't get through any street that led to the church.  Instead I went to Tops and Target and bought some things for home seeing that I couldn't get near the church anytime soon.  The half marathon plagued me every place I went, I couldn't get off the 198 and I had to take the 190 to the 290 to make it home.  Anyways, a brighter no half marathon day today so I can drive anywhere, even to church.
Figured out how to add in smiley faces and current theme music.  Excited now.

I have seen the film that deals with McDonald's and I have decided that I never want to eat fast food again.  Although, Taco Bell still has the wonderful benefits of being so delicious....

I downloaded Microsoft Office into my computer and I now have Powerpoint and Excell which I have been wanting for some time now.  Thanks to UB for providing me with the free software so now I don't have to spend the extra money.  I knew my tuition would give me something, even if it isn't a job right now.

Decided to do a live journal and see how things go.  I was influenced by a coworker at the UB SEL library and so far I am happy with how things are going.  I just need some more advice on how to work and use the live journal to get the full effect.
